Description: Two joining fragments giving profile except for underside of foot of Corinthian pottery plate; flaring wall and rounded rim with two grooves on top; rounded ring foot; glaze fired red-brown and very worn; outside of rim and probably all of foot glazed; band at outer edge of top of rim perhaps extending over grooves; traces of bands at junction with tondo; two pre-firing holes at edge of rim.
Curator's comments: Sherd belongs to same vessel as British Museum 1924,1201.1227.e, 1924, 1201.1227.b and 1924,1201.1227.d. For parallels, see Boardman (1998), p. 193 fig. 383.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.268) (phase 3)
